alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 11 at 6:34PM AKST until December 13 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of up to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Upper Tanana Valley. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 3 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Two rounds of snowfall are expected over the next 48 hours, the first overnight into midday Tuesday, and the second Tuesday evening into Wednesday morning. The second round into Wednesday is expected to produce heavier amounts than then first wave. Additionally, there will be large snowfall gradient up the valley, with total accumulations of 8 inches near Dot Lake and only a couple inches near Northway.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
